sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination:

$x + 2y - 3z = 4$

$2x - 3y + z = -1$

$3x + y + 2z = 7$
message_2:
First, we will write the given system of linear equations in the form of an augmented matrix:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 2 & -3 & 4 \\
2 & -3 & 1 & -1 \\
3 & 1 & 2 & 7
\end{array}\right]
$

Now, we will perform Gaussian elimination to obtain an upper triangular matrix:

1. Swap Row 1 and Row 3:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 2 & 7 \\
2 & -3 & 1 & -1 \\
1 & 2 & -3 & 4
\end{array}\right]
$

2. Replace Row 2 with (-2/3)Row 1 + Row 2:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 2 & 7 \\
0 & -3.67 & -0.33 & -5.67 \\
1 & 2 & -3 & 4
\end{array}\right]
$

3. Replace Row 3 with (-1/3)Row 1 + Row 3:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 2 & 7 \\
0 & -3.67 & -0.33 & -5.67 \\
0 & 1.67 & -3.67 & 0.33
\end{array}\right]
$

4. Swap Row 2 and Row 3:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 2 & 7 \\
0 & 1.67 & -3.67 & 0.33 \\
0 & -3.67 & -0.33 & -5.67
\end{array}\right]
$

5. Replace Row 3 with (-2.2)Row 2 + Row 3:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 2 & 7 \\
0 & 1.67 & -3.67 & 0.33 \\
0 & 0 & 8 & -6
\end{array}\right]
$

Now, we have an upper triangular matrix. We will use back-substitution to find the values of x, y, and z:

1. Divide Row 3 by 8:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 2 & 7 \\
0 & 1.67 & -3.67 & 0.33 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & -0.75
\end{array}\right]
$

From Row 3, we have $z = -0.75$.

2. Replace Row 2 with (3.67)Row 3 + Row 2:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 2 & 7 \\
0 & 1.67 & 0 & 2.5 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & -0.75
\end{array}\right]
$

3. Divide Row 2 by 1.67:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 2 & 7 \\
0 & 1 & 0 & 1.5 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & -0.75
\end{array}\right]
$

From Row 2, we have $y = 1.5$.

4. Replace Row 1 with (-2)Row 3 + Row 1:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 1 & 0 & 8.5 \\
0 & 1 & 0 & 1.5 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & -0.75
\end{array}\right]
$

5. Replace Row 1 with (-1)Row 2 + Row 1:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
3 & 0 & 0 & 7 \\
0 & 1 & 0 & 1.5 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & -0.75
\end{array}\right]
$

6. Divide Row 1 by 3:

$
\left[\begin{array}{ccc|c}
1 & 0 & 0 & 2.33 \\
0 & 1 & 0 & 1.5 \\
0 & 0 & 1 & -0.75
\end{array}\right]
$

From Row 1, we have $x = 2.33$.

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

$x = 2.33$

$y = 1.5$

$z = -0.75$
